metatags.apple-mobile-web-app-title: FactCheck.org - A Project of The Annenberg Public Policy Center
metatags.og:description: Viral posts wrongly claim that a painting depicting children in face masks was created as a mural for the Denver airport in 1994 -- and baselessly suggest the COVID-19 pandemic was planned. The painting is not at the airport, and is not from 1994.
metatags.twitter:creator: @factcheckdotorg
metatags.author: Angelo Fichera

metatags.twitter:title: Children of the World Dream of Peace - Denver Public Art
metatags.twitter:description: “Children of the World Dream of Peace” is a powerful mural expressing the artist’s desire to abolish violence in society. One section of the piece speaks to the tragedy and devastation of war and its impact on humanity. The mural then moves on to images of smiling children, dressed in traditional folk costumes from around … Continued

metatags.twitter:title: Painting of children with flag masks was never displayed at the Denver airport
metatags.og:title: Painting of children with flag masks was never displayed at the Denver airport
metatags.og:description: CLAIM: A painting of several children wearing face masks with their countries’ flags on them appeared in 1994 at the Denver International Airport. AP’S ASSESSMENT: False. The painting does not belong to the Denver airport art collection and has not been displayed there. The image of it began circulating online in February of this year.  THE FACTS: Social media posts that have been viewed thousands of times this week claim a painting of children wearing masks adorned with national flags first appeared at the Denver airport in 1994.
metatags.twitter:description: CLAIM: A painting of several children wearing face masks with their countries’ flags on them appeared in 1994 at the Denver International Airport. AP’S ASSESSMENT: False. The painting does not belong to the Denver airport art collection and has not been displayed there. The image of it began circulating online in February of this year.  THE FACTS: Social media posts that have been viewed thousands of times this week claim a painting of children wearing masks adorned with national flags first appeared at the Denver airport in 1994.
